pullRequest.body: Expect ~12 minutes off every single CI run!

nodes.body:
Thank you: I'm very happy with this!

I reviewed the PR, but honestly I trust more the fact that it passed CI than my review!

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125179011/job/25090834249)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125179011/job/25090834870)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9125179011/job/25090835145)
I will note that most people don't have access to this stream. Is this bad?
I don't have a strong opinion on this, but the bot could post instead on a thread in the nightly testing topic?
It's not about nightly testing, so that looks a bit wrong. Maybe we can just post in #mathlib4 ?
Sure, I just thought that an "opt-in" thread was better than a thread to which everyone is subscribed.
You can always opt out of topics. Maybe topics can even be opt-in?

My thinking was to not put it in any high traffic stream, to avoid spamming people. My preference is to leave as is, but of course if anyone expresses a wish to have access to the output we can move it.
